column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary Comparison - Accuracy Assessment Policy

Objective
Evaluate the accuracy and reliability of two summaries created from a reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary provides a more accurate and reliable representation of the information in the reference text.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly more accurate and reliable than B (Score: -2)
A slightly more accurate and reliable than B (Score: -1)
Both summaries are equally accurate and reliable (Score: 0)
B slightly more accurate and reliable than A (Score: 1)
B significantly more accurate and reliable than A (Score: 2)

Additional Guidance
Consider the completeness, specificity, and adherence to the information in the reference text when evaluating the accuracy and reliability of the summaries. Avoid introducing subjective judgments and focus on the factual representation of information. If the reference text does not provide specific details about the accuracy or correctness of the summaries (A and B) in comparison, refrain from providing a score for the comparison.
